answers.a: This isn’t about E151. Brilliant Black BN (E151) is a synthetic black azo dye used to color foods; it is approved in the EU with an ADI of 5 mg/kg body weight per day but not permitted in U.S. foods.

answers.a: This is unrelated to the additive. Brilliant Black BN (also called Food Black 1 or C.I. 28440) is a water-soluble colorant used to make foods appear black or dark; it’s allowed in the EU/UK but not approved in the U.S.

answers.q: black screen when playing budokai 3 pn pscx2
answers.a: Unrelated query: E151 is a synthetic black dye typically added to sweets, desserts, soft drinks, and some fish products to provide color, often as the tetrasodium salt. Some individuals sensitive to azo dyes may experience hypersensitivity reactions.

answers.a: Not related to E151. Brilliant Black BN is a synthetic black food color (azo dye) used in decorations, coatings, jams, drinks, and some fish products; synonyms include Brilliant Black PN and Food Black 1.
